availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas D. Sedgewick (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier.)

body.p:
Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Lucinda Sedgewick. Married to Priscilla B. Tuley Sedgewick. Father of Thomas D. Sedgewick and Charles T. Sedgewick. Resident of Louisville Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Served in the Second Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a a captain, major, and colonel
from June 3, 1861 until June 19, 1864. Served in the 114th United States Colored Troops (U.S.A.) as a colonel from July 5, 1864 through December 31, 1865. Commanded a brigade in the Union Army XXV Corps.

ab.bibl:

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. Appendix 53.
